data.title: Senior Oracle Technical Operations Analyst
data.meta_description:
Jobs and careers with Network Rail - 

This role sits in Route Services, a business area that has been created to supply services to the routes in the safest, most cost-efficient and effective way, enabling them to benefit from economies of scale and optimised national resources.

Working in the Route Services IT Team, you will provide our customers with smart technology for the railway of today, designing fit-for-purpose and innovative solutions. Your vital work will help to manage the day-to-day running of our vast IT estate, from safety critical systems maintenance to hardware provision, supporting thousands of employees every day.

This is a Senior Oracle Technical Operations Analyst role for the Oracle E-Business Suite 12.2; an HR & Payroll functional specialist within the Technical Operations (ERP) team. We are a team of 30 with a mixture of both functional analysts and technical developers.

Our E-Business Suite is the widest and most complex Oracle estate in Europe. We have HR & Payroll applications, Supply Chain, Procurement, Financials & Projects, and we are hosted in Oracle’s public cloud, OCI.
data.text:
Job Introduction

This role sits in Route Services, a business area that has been created to supply services to the routes in the safest, most cost-efficient and effective way, enabling them to benefit from economies of scale and optimised national resources.

Working in the Route Services IT Team, you will provide our customers with smart technology for the railway of today, designing fit-for-purpose and innovative solutions. Your vital work will help to manage the day-to-day running of our vast IT estate, from safety critical systems maintenance to hardware provision, supporting thousands of employees every day.

This is a Senior Oracle Technical Operations Analyst role for the Oracle E-Business Suite 12.2; an HR & Payroll functional specialist within the Technical Operations (ERP) team. We are a team of 30 with a mixture of both functional analysts and technical developers.

Our E-Business Suite is the widest and most complex Oracle estate in Europe. We have HR & Payroll applications, Supply Chain, Procurement, Financials & Projects, and we are hosted in Oracle’s public cloud, OCI.

Main Responsibility

Be the application expert for a defined portfolio of applications in the Oracle ERP suite Work with the other members of the Application support team in the day-to-day use and development of the system.

The recognised company expert providing day to day functional support for a portfolio of HR/Payroll applications within the Oracle ERP suite, owning the relationship with the business to develop efficient application systems utilising established standards, procedures, and methodologies.

Consult with internal clients on business requirements to provide effective support and development

Drive and lead the technical aspects of multiple projects/small enhancements within assigned area of Oracle ERP portfolio and related business applications

Own and deliver integrated systems planning and drive recommendations for new/different solutions which will enhance current systems and support overall corporate and business goals

Own and define documentation and plans for activities such as configurations, to include but not limited to develop functional test scenarios, perform functional and regression testing, assist with UAT.

Own and drive action of issues with Oracle Support to resolve outstanding issues with Oracle ERP product

Prepare and submit requests for change deployment to change control. Manage the implementation process for new releases of supported applications.

Act as coach and mentor to less-experienced team members

Actively own and manage key stakeholder relationships

The Ideal Candidate

Essential

Proven experience developing and supporting HR/ Payroll 12.2 ERP oracle modules, with the ability to support a minimum of 2 modules, with a proven track record of working in systems related environment

Proven extensive technical knowledge and experience in amending the Oracle vanilla product to company requirements

Demonstrable extensive experience with SQL, workflow, Oracle ERP table structures

Demonstrable extensive knowledge of Oracle AIM methodology (MD50, MD70, BR100 etc)

Demonstrable extensive knowledge of configuration management

Demonstrable experience of change management

Excellent stakeholder management, analytical, organisational and team development skills

Demonstrable, extensive experience of working in a multi-skilled team in a customer focussed environment

Desirable

Knowledge of the railway industry and its regulatory framework

Good understanding of APEX in support of reports/ APEX custom modules.

Understanding of key business processes and IT support processes

Technical knowledge of a specified application/group of applications

We are committed to a diverse workplace enriched with representation from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and skills. We pride ourselves on creating an environment where difference is embraced, and individuals can thrive. We recognise that the success of the team is dependent on a multi-cultural, multi-disciplined group of individuals, aligned to deliver successful solutions.

At Network Rail, we have several employee networks to reflect our diverse population and help to raise issues to the wider workforce and support their membership and support our Everybody Matters strategy, led by our central Diversity & Inclusion team. We have Diversity & Inclusion Champions who take part and lead on many activities, to drive through more initiatives to support an inclusive environment for all its people and promote a professional and positive working environment. For more information on Diversity & Inclusion at Network Rail, please follow this link

Package Description

Vacancy type: Permanent

Location: Manchester Square One / Milton Keynes

Closing date: 7th April 2023

Band & Salary: Band 4C (£41,711 - £46,925)

About us

We’re an organisation where people matter. We matter to millions.

We offer excellent benefits, including:

Flexible working patterns such as hybrid working and working compressed hours

A range of pension schemes

Healthcare Scheme

Rail and underground season ticket subsidies up to 75%

Discounted leisure rail travel up to 75%

28 days annual leave, plus bank holidays and volunteering days (5 days)

2 weeks paid reserve leave for our Armed Forces community

Cycle to Work Scheme

GymPass – Access to gyms across the UK

Access to ‘My Benefits’ portal which include discounts in food, technology, and experience days

About the Company

We’re an organisation where people matter. We matter to millions.

Our role is to run a safe, reliable and efficient railway, serving customers and communities. We exist to get people and goods where they need to be and to support our country’s economic prosperity. Safety is our number one priority. We're undertaking an ambitious change. Our vision is Putting Passengers First - becoming a company that is on the side of passengers and freight users. As one of the UK’s leading equal opportunities employers, our values and the way we behave is important to us and we have created an environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution. We have seven employee networks that provide fantastic support, opportunities and development for applicants from all backgrounds. Click here for more information

Our Drugs and Alcohol Standard is changing as of 16.01.2023. All prospective candidates who have not been offered a conditional role by 16.01.2023 will be required to undergo and pass a drugs and alcohol test. Your application will be rescinded if you record a positive test. All positive drugs and alcohol test results for prospective candidates will be securely held on Sentinel database and a 5 year suspension from applying for a safety critical role, a role which requires PTS certification or a Key Safety role on Network Rail Managed Infrastructure will be enforced.
